feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 3:50PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm Impacting West Coast of Alaska Friday... A strong storm bringing winds, snow and blowing snow will move north over the West Coast of Alaska on Friday. There is a possibility that this storm could bring blizzard conditions to the West Coast Friday into Saturday. This could also bring a slight chance of freezing rain to areas south of Nome on Friday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 5:52AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Light Wintry Mix Expected This Morning... Through 8 AM, a light wintry mix of snow, sleet, and light freezing rain will move southeast across southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa, and southwest Wisconsin. This wintry mix may cause some patchy icing on untreated roads. If driving, be ready for slippery conditions. Know before you go!

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 5:52AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Light Wintry Mix Expected This Morning... Through 8 AM, a light wintry mix of snow, sleet, and light freezing rain will move southeast across southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa, and southwest Wisconsin. This wintry mix may cause some patchy icing on untreated roads. If driving, be ready for slippery conditions. Know before you go!
